Go Back?
The fishermen caught a glimpse of something...
...something unusual.
Down past the lighthouse.
Your mother has gone?
Oh I'm sure she'll be back
I haven't seen her myself I'm afraid.
What a miserable day!
The lighthouse is on the blink as well!
No boats can can come inshore...
...until it's working again.
What a bother!
Wow, the skies have cleared...
...what a beautiful day.
Now if only I could figure out...
...What is wrong with the lighthouse...
Then the fishermen would know where to come!
We used to turn on the power in the basement...
chinese: 以前我們只需要去地庫打開開關……

english: ...but the entrance has long been blocked.
There is another secret entrance, but...
chinese: 是有另一個秘密入口，只不過……

english: ...that comes out a long way from here.
The light has come on!
Finally the boats can come in to harbor.
Hey Hue, it was you?
You turned the power back on?
Well I'll be. Thank you!
The fishermen are back now...
...they got quite lost I believe!
chinese: ……我肯定他們之前完全迷失方向！

english: Now the lighthouse is working...
...boats can come and go again!
If you need a ride anywhere...
I'm sure the fishermen will oblige!
chinese: 我肯定漁夫們會幫你一把！

english: You'd think keeping a lighthouse would be easy...
chinese: 大家都以為管理燈塔是分好差事……

english: But with the power going out...
...and the basement getting blocked...
...well... it's been quite stressful!
I need a nice cup of tea, and a snooze.
chinese: 我需要喝一杯茶，然後小睡片刻。

english: Your mother is back, Hue!
Wonderful!
What a relief it must be.
chinese: 很高興你能放下心頭大石。

english: My mother left long ago.
I'm so pleased you were able to find yours.
chinese: 你能找回媽媽，我為你感到高興。

english: Make sure you make the most of it, Hue.
chinese: 要好好珍惜這次重逢，色調。

english: First, the lighthouse, now your mother...
chinese: 先是攞平燈塔，然後找回媽媽……

english: ...what a remarkable day!
I hope this spell of good luck continues!
chinese: 希望這個好運氣會持續下去！

english: Hellooooo?
Hue is that you?
Thank goodness, I've been trapped for days!
chinese: 謝天謝地，我在這兒困了數天！

english: Help me get out of here!
I keep hearing noises! It's creeping me out!
chinese: 我一直聽到聲音，快要發瘋了！

english: The rocks... they...
they... just disappeared?
I don't know how you did it?
chinese: 我不知你是怎樣做到的。

english: Who cares! I'm saved!
Thank you!
Oh, hey again Hue!
Thanks so much for saving me earlier!
Those caves sure gave me the creeps.
chinese: 那洞穴真的令我嚇破了膽。

english: I don't know how much longer I would have lasted...
chinese: 真不知道當時還能撐多久。

english: ...the rocks had trapped me in!
What a pickle!
How did you do it though, Hue?
chinese: 那你是如何做到的，色調？

english: You made the rocks... just vanish.
chinese: 我指，你就那樣……變走了岩石。

english: Was it magic... witchcraft?
Perhaps you can make my bills disappear too...
chinese: 如果你能變走我的付款單……

english: ...wouldn't that be something!
Hey Hue! You saved your mother too?
chinese: 嘿，色調！你今次救出了媽媽？

english: Or did she save you?
It must be your new...
...mysterious powers, woOOoo.
I told your mother about how you saved me...
chinese: 我告訴了你的媽媽，說你如何救出我。

english: she was so proud!
Rightfully so, I owe you a beer...
...I mean a juice!
I'm hanging up my mining boots for good!
chinese: 我掛靴了。再也不掘礦了。

english: I never found anything anyway...
chinese: 反正我從沒掘到些甚麼……

english: ...I might look for shells on the beach instead.
Oh hello there!
You startled me...
I'm just resting my legs...
Don't play too close to the water now!
I've heard there are caves through the waterfall...
chinese: 我聽說過，瀑布後面有洞穴……

english: ...apparently they stretch for miles.
chinese: ……一個又一個洞穴，連綿不斷、沒有盡頭。

english: I would never go myself though.
It's far too dangerous!
I come down here to collect water sometimes...
...it's much nicer than from the well.
Isn't the sound of water relaxing?
I could just sit here and listen all day.
chinese: 我可以坐在這兒聽一整天。

english: Hello again Hue.
Great to see you and your mother are safe!
chinese: 很高興你跟你的媽媽平安再會！

english: Hopefully we'll cross paths...
chinese: 說不定我們也會再次巧遇……

english: ...maybe we can visit that waterfall again.
I had no idea when we last met, down by the waterfall...
chinese: 上次在瀑布邊遇見你時，我完全沒想過……

english: ...that you were going on such an adventure!
How exciting!
I would offer you a drink, but it's my last bottle!
chinese: 我想請你喝一杯茶，但我的水不夠了。

english: I need to take another trip to the waterfall.
Maybe another day... today has been so busy!
Hey watch it buddy!
Stop that!
How could you be so heartless!
Skeletons hanging over here!
chinese: 本骨懸若日月，不會動搖！

english: Quit it!
I'd come down there...
...but I don't have the guts!
You're not getting under my skin!
You're making me queasy...
I don't have the stomach for it.
Oh hey, you!
You're not supposed to be here!
The University is closed...
The pipes have burst, there's slime everywhere!
chinese: 水管爆裂了，到處都是污水！

english: Best be on your way.
I won't say it again!
The University is closed!
Away with you!
Aren't you a bit young to be at University anyway?
chinese: 況且大學本來就不是豆丁來的地方吧？

english: I must be getting old.
Now get out of here, before I lose my patience!
chinese: 好了快點出去，別要我發脾氣！

english: Come on kid, I'm trying to mop up here.
chinese: 求求你了小豆丁，我只是個清潔工。

english: Don't cause a scene, I'm just doing my job.
chinese: 別令我難做好嗎，我只是打工的。

english: Now scram!
Okay, if you're going to hassle me, how about a joke?
chinese: 好，既然你堅持不走，那就聽我說一個笑話吧？

english: What did the janitor say when he jumped out the closet?
chinese: 大學生首天上班，要負責清潔。他說，我是名大學生！

english: Supplies!
chinese: 清潔工聽了說，抱歉原來你是大學生。讓我教你掃地。

english: Huehuehue...
Now scoot!
Hey little landlubber!
I'm just dropping off the catch.
You need to get to the University?...
...I'm setting sail shortly!
Hop inside and I'll give you a ride!
Not long until we set sail!
Thank goodness the lighthouse is working now...
chinese: 燈塔沒事實在是太好了……

english: ...I was sailing around in circles!
We'll raise anchor when you're ready!
chinese: 等你準備好我們就出發！

english: Nice day for a spot of sailing!
chinese: 今天是適宜出海的好天！

english: Step inside and we'll hit the seas!
Phew, that was a rough ride!
Looks like you found your sea legs though.
The University is up in the mountains...
There should be a cable car, at the base of the mountain.
Otherwise you'll have a rocky climb!
chinese: 不然就只能攀岩登山了！

english: If you head East, you should see a sign for the University.
chinese: 往東走，就會看見大學的路牌。

english: It shouldn't take you long to get there.
I'll be here a while, so take your time.
chinese: 我會逗留一段時間，你可以慢慢來。

english: It's a bit chilly isn't it?
I need to get a better coat.
Those seals have the right idea.
Eat enough fish to get nice and fat.
chinese: 天天吃魚吃得又圓又胖。

english: They look pretty warm under all that blubber.
chinese: 被那麼多脂肪包著一定很暖。

english: Did you hear about the red ship that collided with the blue ship?
chinese: 聽說紅船跟藍船撞在一起了……

english: All the sailors were marooned!
chinese: 全部船員都漂流到了不知那兒！

english: Well I'll be... look who it is!
chinese: 時候也不早了……呀，看誰來了！

english: It's wonderful to see you both again!
I never doubted you'd find each other.
chinese: 我沒有懷疑過你們能不能重逢。

english: You both look exhausted... let me fire up the 'ol vessel.
chinese: 你們看上去都累了……讓我發動引擎。

english: I'll get you back to the village in no time.
chinese: 眨眼的功夫就能帶你們回去。

english: Hey little landlubber!
It's so great to see you two reunited.
You both slept the whole way back.
You must have been so tired!
I can take you back to the University...
...did you leave something behind?
I'm ready when you are!
It's a clear sky, perfect for a quick sail!
chinese: 萬里無雲，最適合出海不過！

english: Feel free to jump aboard.
I need someone to scrub the deck!
Good morning Hue!
Isn't it great to be home...
...everything is back the way it should be.
When we arrived...
...everyone was so pleased to see us!
I suppose, I kind of took our friends for granted...
chinese: 我想，我忽略了我們的朋友……

english: ...I was too caught up in my research.
I think my researching days are over...
...or at least, I'm going to take a hiatus.
Never say never...
...even after everything we've been through!
Wow, you're a long way from home, kid!
chinese: 嘩，孩子，你怎麼會在這兒？

english: What are you doing all the way down here?
chinese: 山長水遠的，你走來幹甚麼？

english: I've just got this generator working.
The lights have turned on!
I read stories about an ancient civilisation...
chinese: 我讀過一本書說有個遠古文明……

english: ...building great machines, many years ago.
chinese: ……在很久以前做了很多偉大的機器。

english: I came down here to see for myself.
Quite incredible really!
There's so many wires...
...so much electricity!
Keep an eye out for lasers.
They're very dangerous!
Hey kid, great to see you again!
Did you come across any more machines?
I turned back at the lasers...
chinese: 我見到激光就走回頭了。

english: I didn't want to get zapped!
Quite the adventure you've been on!
chinese: 原來你經歷了一場大冒險？！

english: How you got through those lasers...
chinese: 那些激光居然能避開嗎……

english: ...you're a brave one, I'll give you that!
We'll have to take a trip into the caves sometime...
chinese: 我們該找天再去洞穴一趟……

english: I'd love to see how you got so far!
chinese: 我想看看你是如何走過去的！

english: Not today though... I just got back!
chinese: 不過今天就免了……我才剛剛回來！

english: What a crazy few days!
H-h-h-heeeeey! Wheere d'ya think yeeer goin'?
chinese: 哈嘿嘿嘿！尼咿為尼在去拿兒？

english: Whaaat?
Who is that? Mmmhmmm.
Y-y-y-yessss! Faaalling rocks! Deeeath!
chinese: 耶耶耶～～耶！絡絡絡石！死死！

english: Go back! Back... back... back...
Whoooo?
N-n-n-noooo. Greeeaat ciiircles of air!
chinese: 不不不。大大大圓圓圓圈圈圈！

english: Stretch to the sky! Ahhhh!
Fly awaaay litttttle boy..
Hey there little traveler.
You look a long way from home...
...what are you doing in these woods all alone?
chinese: ……你一個人在森林裡幹些甚麼呢？

english: The cable car to the University is out of service.
The only way is up through the mountains.
It's a dangerous climb, I wouldn't try it if I was you.
chinese: 很危險。我勸你還是回去吧。

english: I'm just gathering some fire wood.
It gets cold at night in these mountains.
chinese: 山裡入夜後很冷，需要柴火。

english: Make sure you stay warm!
I wonder what your business is at the University.
In the colder months, I collect firewood for them.
chinese: 冬天的時候他們會找我斬柴。

english: If you walk on past the entrance, I keep some wood in the rocks.
chinese: 我存了一些柴，在大門裡面的大石那邊。

english: Someone keeps putting this shiny beaker in there.
chinese: 有人堅持不停將這個燒杯放在這兒。

english: Very strange.
Dearest Hue,
Oh, I've had the most dreadful luck.
chinese: 噢，我的運氣糟得不能再糟。

english: I feel terrible that you've been left alone all this time.
chinese: 要留下你一個人令我心如刀割。

english: The traitorous Dr. Grey tried to steal the Annular Spectrum - a ring I developed to allow perception and alteration of colour.
chinese: 吃裏扒外的灰博士想偷走環彩光戒。那是我所開發的能夠觀察和改變色彩的戒指。

english: Some call them impossible colours. Hah! Impossible for Dr. Grey maybe.
chinese: 有人說色彩是虛假的，稱之曰虛色。哈！對灰博士來說確實是虛空。

english: Anyway, something went wrong.
I turned a strange shade and became invisible.
chinese: 我變成了奇特的色彩，隱形了。

english: The ring... it fractured, scattering coloured shards far and wide.
chinese: 環彩光戒……粉碎了，色彩的碎片四散。

english: I stayed at home for many weeks, watching, waiting.
chinese: 我在家裡觀察了數星期，一直在等。

english: Existing on this coloured plane, I couldn't speak to you, nor interact with anything in the mono-world.
chinese: 身處顏色位面的我不能跟你對話，也無法接觸單色調世界的事物。

english: So I left. I left for the University where I hid away the coloured tools I had created.
chinese: 所以我走了。我要去大學，找回我所藏起的色彩道具。

english: I pray you have found what is left of the ring.
chinese: 我懇切祈求你能找到環彩光戒的碎片。

english: Since the beginning, we have pointed to the sky and declared it blue.
chinese: 太古以來，我們指目天空，稱之曰藍。

english: It is this shared vision, this unquestioned understanding which connects us.
chinese: 是人所共知的領域，是聯繫人與人的共同概念。

english: But are you really seeing blue the same way I see it?
chinese: 但你眼中的藍，跟我眼中的藍是一樣的嗎？

english: Perhaps blue is nothing more than a shade of grey to you.
chinese: 也許，你所見的藍，其實只是不同深淺的灰。

english: Perhaps everyone in this world sees nothing but shades of grey.
chinese: 也許，這個世界的所有人，眼中都只有深深淺淺的灰。

english: Don't you see Hue? This... this is why we're here.
chinese: 色調，你看見了嗎？這是我們的意義。

english: When you enter a cave expecting a waterfall, the chances are your expectations will be met.
chinese: 當你來到洞穴想看瀑布時，你大概會得償所願。

english: But if you discard those expectations, don't you think instead, the cave will be full of surprises?
chinese: 但是只要你能放下成見，洞穴有可能充滿著驚喜，你說不是嗎？

english: I ask for you, Hue, to abandon your expectations.
chinese: 所以，色調，我希望你能放下成見。

english: To pull me back from the brink of unreality...
chinese: 將我從超現實帶回來的唯一指望……

english: I need you to see the world not for what it is... but for what it can be.
chinese: 就是你不被現象所蒙蔽，能看透世事的可能性。

english: Did you know, Hue, that purple is at the very end of the visible spectrum?
chinese: 你知道嗎，色調？原來紫色是可見光譜的盡頭。

english: It's the hardest colour for our eyes to distinguish.
chinese: 它是用肉眼最難以分辦的色彩。

english: Now imagine... a shade one step further than purple..
chinese: 現在試想像一下……比紫色更上一層的色彩……

english: A colour beyond what we can actually perceive.
chinese: 一種超越目視界限的色彩。

english: We call these impossible colours...
and I fear that this... this is where I currently reside.
chinese: 而我恐怕……正是變成了虛色。

english: If reality is rooted in our perception and you cannot perceive me, do I even exist to you?
chinese: 當真實建基於觀察，而你無法觀察我，那你覺得我還存在嗎？

english: I'm sure that I do, I mean, you're reading this letter, or at least... I hope you are.
chinese: 我肯定我是存在的。畢竟你在讀我的信。最少，我希望你能讀得到。

english: I'm sorry but... existing in this strange state of impermanence does funny things to you Hue.
chinese: 很對不起，色調……當你的存在變得虛無時……你會變得奇怪。

english: It makes you question... what is real?
The University gardens were bathed in an earthy, orange light when I first met Dr. Grey.
chinese: 當我首次遇見灰博士時，大學籠罩在踏實的橙光之下。

english: Summer had come and gone, and a cold autumnal crispness had caught me off guard.
chinese: 夏天來了又去，秋日的乾冷殺我一個措手不及。

english: I sat on the grass, surrounded by my books and papers, when a cool breeze threatened to blow my notes across the lawn.
chinese: 我坐在草坪上，左右都是文獻，突然來一陣冷風將它們打亂。

english: A page escaped my reach and took flight.
chinese: 有一張紙逃離我的手，乘風起舞。

english: A man not much older than myself chased after it, catching it on his third or fourth attempt.
chinese: 一名比我年紀大一點的男仕追著它，抓了三四次後終於成功。

english: I remember his gentle smile when he returned it.
chinese: 還記得他物歸原主時展露的和藹笑容。

english: He started talking and I was surprised that he had read my work in the University journal.
chinese: 我們談了起來。他居然在大學學報上讀過我的論文！

english: He said he was a professor, and that... he hoped we could work together someday.
chinese: 他說他是一名教授，並且……希望我們有天能合作。

english: It's funny Hue... how something so small... can change so much.
chinese: 世事真奇妙……這樣一件小事……會影響深遠。

english: Dr. Grey soon became my assigned mentor and... I can't help but feel he somehow had a hand in it.
chinese: 過不久灰博士就成了我的導師……我覺得是他安排的。

english: Our fires burnt brightest when we worked together. It felt like we could achieve anything.
chinese: 在一起時，我們的潛能得到最大發揮，彷彿無所不能。

english: We discovered more about colour than I could ever have imagined.
chinese: 我們對色彩的瞭解變得超乎想像。

english: We split light, mapped spectrums, we painted, we laughed... we worked long hours, and soon our goal became all-consuming.
chinese: 我們分離光線、紀錄光譜、一起繪影、一起歡笑……我們日夜工作，只懂得向目標奔馳。

english: We were vessels. The work became more important than us, and we knew it.
chinese: 我們是載體。是項研究比我們更重要，我們都清楚。

english: It's funny, I don't remember much after that day on the grass.
chinese: 真有趣，那次草地相遇後的事我不怎麼記得。

english: I do know that Dr. Grey and I spent many a time together.
chinese: 不過我知道我和灰博士經常在一起。

english: I would compliment him on his work, and his cheeks would flush with a pinkness, hah!
chinese: 我會稱讚他的研究，而他則會兩頰差紅。哈！

english: He'd notice and change the subject, embarrassed.
chinese: 然後，察覺到自己臉紅了，他會尷尬地轉變話題。

english: This work we were doing together... it didn't feel much like work any more.
chinese: 雖然日夜苦幹……但我們都不覺得辛苦。

english: Did you know, Hue, that every language first has a word for black and for white, for dark and for light?
chinese: 你知道嗎，色調，世上所有語言都先有'黑'字和'白'字、'光'和'暗'？

english: The first colour described afterwards is always... red. The colour of blood and wine. The colour of anger.
chinese: 然後，第一項色彩必然是……紅。血與酒的色彩。憤怒的色彩。

english: The anger I felt... when, I was told my experiments had gone too far.
chinese: 我體會了這憤怒……當我，被告知說我的實驗太過火……

english: When Dr. Grey sided with the University, stopping my research altogether.
chinese: 當灰博士他站在大學的一方，徹底終止我的研究時。

english: For all our languages, for all our ways to communicate, it's funny how sometimes we simply cannot.
chinese: 我們有語文，有筆墨紙硯，卻可笑地依然會無法溝通。

english: It leads people to do things they regret.
To steal, to break, to forget what is important.
Once a seed has taken root, it doesn't take long for it to grow, to nurture and blossom into something beautiful.
chinese: 一旦種子生根發芽，它過自然會茁壯成長、開花結果。

english: The seed of knowledge was planted in my mind, and I wasn't prepared to let it wilt and die.
chinese: 知慧之種已經在我腦裡發芽了，我不打算讓它凋零。

english: The University claimed my experiments were unethical. That altering the fabric of our reality was dangerous.
chinese: 大學說我的實驗不倫理。說改變色法太凶險。

english: They were unflinching. My research was confiscated and my contract terminated.
chinese: 他們心意已決。我的研究被沒收，合約被終止。

english: Following my expulsion, I was left with no choice but to uproot, and move us both far away.
chinese: 被逐出後，我的唯一選擇是撇下留戀，帶你遠走他鄉。

english: I knew of a small fishing village, a boat ride from The University, where I hoped my reputation wouldn't precede me.
chinese: 在距離大學一程船的地方有條小漁村，他們應該不知道我。

english: You and I moved into a humble home, which is now where you've spent most of your childhood.
chinese: 我和你搬進一所小屋，你在那兒渡過了童年。

english: Do you recall those dusty old tomes that used to sit on my desk? The ancient scriptures, of civilisations lost?
chinese: 你還記得我桌上的陳年宗卷嗎？那些遺落文明的遠古文書？

english: I spent hours poring over them, searching for clues to support my research.
chinese: 我一日復一日地研讀，尋找能支持研究的證據。

english: Aside from their wonders, one thing stood out above all else... blue. Or more specifically, the absence of it.
chinese: 在諸多異象奇事中，一件事特別格格不入……那就是藍。他們沒有藍。

english: Other colours were detailed at length; but not blue, it was never mentioned at all. The word simply didn’t exist.
chinese: 他們詳盡紀錄了各種色彩，獨缺藍。壓根兒沒有代表藍色的字。

english: Could they not distinguish blue? Without a word to describe it, how can we be sure they could see it at all?
chinese: 他們認不出藍嗎？沒有字，我們從何得知他們能不能辨別藍色？

english: Spring was around the corner. Yellow daffodils poked through the dirt in our backyard.
chinese: 春日將至，咱們的後院開出一株株黃色的水仙花。

english: As time moved, my resentment slowly slipped away.
chinese: 事過境遷，我也淡忘了我的憤怒。

english: I continued my research from home. Without Dr. Grey, work was slow, but I still made progress.
chinese: 我在家裡繼續研究。失去灰博士後進展緩慢，但有緩慢進展。

english: One day, Hue, when you were sleeping... I watched over you.
chinese: 有一天，當色調你在睡覺時……我看著你。

english: I was on the cusp of a breakthrough, and you were the last person left to see it.
chinese: 我來到突破點，但見證人就只剩下你。

english: I was so excited... for the both of us.
My research led me to tales of a long lost civilisation.
chinese: 在研究中我接觸很多關於一個失落文明的故事。

english: They built great machines... pioneering electricity many years before we discovered it.
chinese: 他們做出偉大的機器……遠比我們早發現、運用電力。

english: Strangely though, this civilisation is said to have felt no pain.
chinese: 奇怪的是，他們不能感覺痛楚。

english: They knew of pain, and observed it, yet could not experience it themselves.
chinese: 他們知道痛楚，能觀察痛楚，但無法體驗痛楚。

english: Explaining to them the sensation of pain, is like me explaining colour...
chinese: 要向他們解釋痛楚﹐就好像我要解釋色彩……

english: ...to someone that can only see in black and white.
I wonder Hue, if we will be able to share in our experiences of colour.
chinese: 我在想，色調，我們真的能分享色彩的喜悅嗎。

english: The first time I wore the ring... I could see a coloured image of the sun.
chinese: 當我第一次載上環彩色戒時，我瞥見了太陽的色彩。

english: Aqua, purple, orange, pink, red, blue, yellow and green.
Great fireworks played out across the backdrop to my reality.
Was I dreaming? Was I alive? My senses, dulled from a lifetime of monotone, struggled with the revelation.
chinese: 這是夢嗎？我還在生嗎？我的知覺，被單色調壓抑了一生的知覺，來不及應對。

english: Time eased. Colours danced in slow motion... like Pollock painting a ballet on the moon.
chinese: 時間停下了。眾色緩緩地舞躍……尤如波洛克在月球上滴畫。

english: I removed the ring and time slipped back to normal.
chinese: 除下戒指的一刻，時間就恢復如常。

english: Colour dissolved into grey. It was overwhelming, but what followed affected me the most.
chinese: 色彩褪去，灰暗回歸。很震撼，但接下來更震撼。

english: After seeing in colour for the first time, when everything returned to normal, I could remember in colour.
chinese: 在恢復正常後，我依然記得色彩。我從沒見過色彩，只看了一眼。

english: I had never once before had a coloured memory.
chinese: 我從都沒有過有色彩的記憶。

english: The more I experienced, the more I realised how little I was experiencing.
chinese: 我越發體驗，就越發明白自己多麼無知。

english: Seeing the world in true colour, was not true at all.
chinese: 看見世界的真彩，看見色彩非真相。

english: The goalposts had just been moved a little further down an infinite playing field.
chinese: 真理之道無窮無盡，永遠會有新的目標。

english: These shades... they are a paradigm away from what I could ever imagine, and yet, how much more there must be!
chinese: 這些新的色彩……超脫我所能想像的框架，卻多如繁星。

english: Is there ever such a thing as true reality, Hue? Does truth exist in our minds, the same way that colour does?
chinese: 真相是真實的嗎，色調？會不會，真相只是一種思維概念，如同色彩？

english: Maybe next I'll stumble upon a third-dimension. Hah! Could you imagine?!
chinese: 說不定我有一天會遇上三次元，哈！試想像一下！

english: If a tree stands in the woods, and nobody is there to see it, does that tree exist?
chinese: 樹立於林，卻無人所知，那這樹還存在嗎？

english: Does it have colour and form? Does it matter?
chinese: 有色彩麼？有形體麼？都重要麼？

english: This journey has been difficult, Hue, and whilst I have trodden a lost, winding path...
chinese: 這很不容易，色調。即使踏過了千迴百折……

english: ...I feel no closer to the truth I was after. No matter how long you chase the moon...
chinese: ……我感覺沒有更接近真相。不論你追逐月亮多久……

english: If truth does exist in our minds, then I feel there may be one that I have neglected.
chinese: 我覺得，如果真相只是一種思想，也許這就是我的盲點。

english: All this time, you've been alone, and now uprooted, on a journey for my cause.
chinese: 一直以來你都是一個人，現在更被迫為我去冒險。

english: For what? So I could see the world a little clearer?
chinese: 所為何事？為讓我能更好的窺探世界？

english: I do hope in the end, it was worth it. For both of us.
chinese: 希望會有值回票值的成果。你我彼此。

english: Being back at the University has surfaced many memories, Hue.
chinese: 回到大學勾起了我的許多回憶，色調。

english: I remember taking you to lectures... you would crawl to the front of the hall when I wasn’t paying attention.
chinese: 我記得帶著你上課……你會乘我不留神的時候爬到前面。

english: Dr. Grey would look down from his lectern, and all his seriousness and authority would wash away.
chinese: 灰博士會從講臺上向下望，然後脫去他的嚴肅和權威。

english: He would pick you up, walk over and return you to my arms with a smile.
chinese: 他會將你抱起，走過來，笑著將你歸還我的懷抱。

english: Love cannot be measured, Hue. Like colour, it exists inside of us. I buried it.
chinese: 愛是無法測量的，色調。它在我們心內，如同色彩。我埋沒了它。

english: I buried the love that I had, for my own ends. I hope, after all this, you will see my mistakes for what they are.
chinese: 我自私地埋沒了我的愛。待一切完結時，我希望你能辨明我的錯。

english: Yours lovingly, Mum.
Dearest Hue, it has been too long. You have grown so much.
Your mother... I tried to warn her.
chinese: 你的媽媽……我提醒過她了。

english: I thought that exiling her from the University would protect her... would protect you...
chinese: 我本以為逐去她就能夠保護她……能夠保護你……

english: She did not understand that some people choose not to see.
chinese: 她不明白，有些人會視而不見。

english: I never stole the ring from her, Hue. I tried to destroy it... before it destroyed her.
chinese: 我沒有偷她的環彩色戒。我只是試圖摧毀它……免得它摧毀你的媽媽。

english: I now know she had it under control. She knew what she was doing.
chinese: 我現在知道她當時已經充分掌握了戒指。她知道她在做甚麼。

english: My intervention shattered the ring, altering your mother's very fabric.
chinese: 當我擊碎戒指時，也同時改變了你的媽媽的構成。

english: My only reprieve, is that you were able to follow in her footsteps... to experience her work first-hand.
chinese: 我唯一的救贖就是，讓你追隨她的足跡……體驗她的成果。

english: We do not see things as they are Hue, instead we see them as we are.
chinese: 我們不是在看事物的真相，色調。我們是在看自己的。

english: Your mother... she has been waiting for you. I expect she will be thrilled to see how far you've come.
chinese: 你的媽媽……在等你。看見克服了重重困難的你，她應該會欣喜若狂。

english: P.S. You cannot always control what happens to you, but you can choose how you see it.
chinese: 又及，雖然你無法拒絕發生在你身上的事，但你可以選擇你的角度。

english: Now you can see true colour, you must decide if it is for better or worse.
chinese: 既然你能看見真彩，你得決定這是好是壞。

english: I hope, after all this, it is for the better.
chinese: 經歷了這麼多，我衷心希望是好的。
